page.title: 01The Town of Fraserburgh
page.content: Fraserburgh is a town at the north - eastern tip of Scotland. Locals call the town{"The Broch"}and call themselves{"Brochers".}The town has {bus}services and a swimming pool and lots of other facilities. There is a large{harbour}which is very important to many people who live in the area because it provides many different types of jobs. There are{fishermen, {boat-builders,}people who work in the {fish market}and{fish processing factories. There are also the usual range of jobs in{businesses}and an excelent variety of{shops}in the town. Fraserburgh has about 12{pubs}and {clubs.}My father is secretary and treasurer of the Consolidated Pneumatic Sports and Social Club for workers at the compressor factory . {Andrew Kilpatrick}(14)
